comments: <!-- Translation: Unidentified shuttle! Your docking credentials are invalid. Identify yourself. -->

responses.text: Um... What?!
I can't understand you!

0.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
0.text: Mragrasohrra rramramra! Sha rrakarra rrasohgraka karra kakagra. Grasoh shamra rra.

responses.text: What's a Dracon?
How am I supposed to do that?
Can he understand me?

1.speaker: Mysterious Voice
1.text: It's a Dracon. He's telling you that your docking credentials are invalid. He wants you to identify yourself.

responses.text: Don't tell me he's going to try to eat me!
You forgot to mention how I'm supposed to communicate with him.
Great. A smart, predatory alien.

2.speaker: Mysterious Voice
2.text: That's the word for them that makes the most sense in your language. They're carnivorous, like to eat a lot of meat and fish. Their homeworld is mostly covered in water, but they can move on land as well. And, you know, smart. Predatory at times, but smart.

responses.text: Uh-oh. This could be bad.
I'm sick of surprises.
I'll just use body language to communicate.

3.speaker: Mysterious Voice
3.text: If you do enough talking, his translator should pick up your language. You don't have a translator, though. That might be a problem.

responses.text: Uh-oh. This could be bad.
I'm sick of surprises.
I'll just use body language to communicate.

4.speaker: Mysterious Voice
4.text: Probably not, until his translator picks up enough of your language. You don't have a translator though. That might be a problem.

responses.text: Uh-oh. This could be bad.
I'm sick of surprises.
I'll just use body language to communicate.

5.speaker: Mysterious Voice
5.text: No, the Dracon are civilized. They don't prey on sentient beings. And he should figure out that you're sentient, provided you say something intelligent. His translator will work out your language soon enough. But you don't have a translator, which could be a problem.

comments: <!-- Translation: This is your second warning! Identify yourself, or I will board your shuttle by force. -->

responses.text: What's he saying?

6.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
6.text: Rragra gra sha mrasha karra! Mramra sha rrasohgraka, rra mra' rraka sha rramramra ss rramra.

responses.text: Crap! What do I do?
Can he wait a minute? I need some time to think.
Can't you just tell him what's happening?

7.speaker: Mysterious Voice
7.text: He's just given you your second warning. He's threatening to board your shuttle by force if you don't provide credentials. Pretty serious about his job, this one.

responses.text: Okay. I'll let him board.
No, it's safer if he stays out there.

8.speaker: Mysterious Voice
8.text: You're just going to have to talk and hope that his translator picks up your language quickly. It'll be better if he can see you. Letting him board the shuttle might be a good move.

9.speaker: Mysterious Voice
9.text: He'll blow the shuttle open if you don't make a move soon. Station Zero is serious about their security.

10.speaker: Mysterious Voice
10.text: Private channel, remember? Only you can hear me. And it'll just make things worse if they know I'm here.

comments: <!-- Fade to black, then back in again with Gleaming Shoal's avatar present in the shuttle scene. -->
<!-- Translation: It's an alien. Right, Kismet? -->

responses.text: Hello.
I come in peace.
Alright, let's all calm down now.

11.speaker: Gleaming Shoal

responses.text: Fine, I'll let him in.
No. I'll take my chances.

12.speaker: Mysterious Voice
12.text: I really can't recommend that course of action. Stay silent in here and they're probably going to assume the worst.

responses.text: END

comments: <!-- Translation: It doesn't seem to have a translator. -->

responses.text: That one sounds different from the other one.
They're different species, right?

14.speaker: Kismet
14.text: Vu shakary' ves sha keika kei kyvulaikeisha.

responses.text: That's good, right?
Hello, Kismet.
Can you two understand me yet?

15.speaker: Mysterious Voice
15.text: That's an Asura. Female. The other one, the Dracon... he called her Kismet. She seems to be his employee. Oh, and she's noticed that you don't have a translator.

comments: <!-- Translation: I'm starting to get bits and pieces. Talk more, please. -->

responses.text: I think I like her better than the other one.
My intentions are peaceful, I assure you.
Hello? Do you understand me yet?

16.speaker: Kismet
16.text: Vu' lakeirei sha ka vu vu reika. Kei shadru, kukuka.

comments: <!-- Translation: Yes, my name is Kismet. Who are you? -->

responses.text: Yes, Kismet. Is that your name?
I think I like her better than the other one.
My intentions are peaceful, I assure you.

17.speaker: Kismet
17.text: Ka, vv keika vu Kismet. Vusha keidru lu?

comments: <!-- Translation: I'm starting to get bits and pieces. Talk more, please. -->

responses.text: I think I like her better than the other one.
My intentions are peaceful, I assure you.
Hello? Do you understand me yet?

18.speaker: Kismet
18.text: Vu' lakeirei sha ka vu vu reika. Kei shadru, kukuka.

comments: <!-- Translation: Okay, I think I have a partial translation. Reversing. Let's see if this works. -->

responses.text: Wait, I understood part of that.

19.speaker: Kismet
19.text: Shakis, vu druval vu keika kei keivu kyvulaikeivusa. Drudrarei. Let's see if druvu sha.

comments: <!-- Translation: What is your name? What is your species called? -->

responses.text: My name? I... don't actually know.
Believe me, I wish I could tell you.

20.speaker: Kismet
20.text: Vuvei lu your name? Vukei vu lu species keika?

comments: <!-- Translation: It doesn't know its own name? -->

responses.text: I told you, I don't know.
I can't remember anything. I have amnesia.
My, uh... my species doesn't have names.

21.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
21.text: Gra rramra' rra gra rra name?

responses.text: Wait, I do understand. I just have amnesia.

22.speaker: Kismet
22.text: I don't think it understands the question.

responses.text: It means I'm missing memories.
Not really. It's not contagious.

23.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
23.text: What is amnesia? Is that a disease?

comments: <!-- Translation: Another species without names? That always makes communication complicated. Maybe we should get a Hallowed in here. -->

responses.text: I'm sorry I can't answer more of your questions. I have amnesia.

24.speaker: Kismet
24.text: Another species without names? That always makes shadravukeisa shakuvukeika. Maybe we should get a keidruka in here.

responses.text: My homeworld was destroyed. I'm the only survivor. I'm here as a refugee.
Something destroyed my homeworld. I'm the only survivor. I'm here looking for answers.
I woke up on a shuttle headed here. I don't remember where I came from and I've got nowhere else to go.

25.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
25.text: I see. What is your purpose on Station Zero? We have not had... visitors of your kind before.

responses.text: Some questions. I'm missing memories of who I am and where I'm from.

26.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
26.text: It prevents you from answering questions?

responses.text: Wait. I have a note that might help explain.
It's the truth.
I don't know what else to tell you.

27.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
27.text: We've had no reports of any planetary destruction events. If your people were sophisticated enough to build a space shuttle like this, they would certainly have been known to us. Your story doesn't add up.

responses.text: Wait. I have a note that might help explain.
It's the truth.
I don't know what else to tell you.

28.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
28.text: That's a very strange story, if true. Not only is it strange, but it's also convenient. Do you expect me to believe that you're incapable of answering the most basic of questions about yourself?

29.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
29.text: A note? Hmm... Let me see that.

responses.text: Oh. Neither can I.
I was hoping you could read it, since I can't.

30.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
30.text: Is this your written language, alien? I don't understand it.

responses.text: What do you mean?
And the options are...?
Look, it's not hard. Just let me on the station.

31.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
31.text: Keep it. If your memories are gone, as you say, then perhaps you'll be able to understand it one day. In the meantime, I must decide what to do with you.

responses.text: What do you mean?
And the options are...?
Look, it's not hard. Just let me on the station.

32.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
32.text: I don't know what you are, alien. It's a miracle that we're able to understand each other. Without more information, it's going to be difficult to decide what to do with you.

responses.text: You can't just maroon me! That's a death sentence.
Then you're responsible for genocide. I'm the last of my kind.
Surely you don't treat other aliens this way.
I'm not contagious, and I don't remember any cultural customs.

33.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
33.text: I can't give you clearance to enter Station Zero. You could be carrying an alien contagion, or your cultural customs could be dangerous to other station residents. The only safe thing to do with you is to launch your shuttle toward the nearest uninhabited planet.

34.speaker: Kismet
34.text: The alien's right, Gleaming Shoal. Marooning the alien might be the safest option, but it's morally unjustifiable. The Council would never agree to it.

35.speaker: Kismet
35.text: No. We don't. Gleaming Shoal, you can't just send the alien away. The Council would never agree. We could have much to learn from this... creature.

36.speaker: Kismet
36.text: Gleaming Shoal, think about what you're doing. We have scientists who can determine whether this alien is capable of harming anyone on the station. The Council will be angry if you simply send it away before we can learn more about it.

37.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
37.text: Quiet, Kismet. I am the station's docks administrator. I have authority over who stays and who goes. The Council can take issue with my actions, but I am responsible for the safety of Station Zero, and I will do my duty. We know nothing about this alien.

38.speaker: Kismet
38.text: Yes, precisely. We know nothing. And our scientists, our diplomats, our archivists would be furious if you kept it that way. If what this alien says is true, this could be our last chance to preserve an entire culture. Even if it remembers nothing, we could still learn much from its biology.

responses.text: Can I talk yet?

39.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
39.text: Mrakarra ka... You speak out of turn, Kismet. Remember who is in charge here.

40.speaker: Kismet
40.text: I defer to you, Gleaming Shoal... as always. I simply don't want you to make a costly mistake.

41.speaker: Kismet
41.text: If you want to live, alien, you should keep your mouth closed.

responses.text: Thank you.
What have you decided to do instead?
Oh, good. Surviving on my own would be hard. I don't even know what kind of food I can eat.

42.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
42.text: Sometimes I think you exist to insubordinate me. Very well, alien. Kismet's argument has... made an impression. I have decided against launching your shuttle toward an uninhabited world.

responses.text: Yes, I understand.
How do I prove that I don't pose a threat?
How long will I be in quarantine?

43.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
43.text: You will be placed in quarantine on the station until it can be proven, beyond a doubt, that you pose no threat to the station's other residents. If you attempt to leave quarantine without permission, deadly force will be used to prevent you from doing so. Do you understand?

responses.text: I appreciate you giving me this chance.
Their tests had better not be too invasive.
A xeno-what now? Either your translator glitched or that's a word I don't know.

44.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
44.text: Good. Our scientists will want to examine you. There will be a xenobiologist and a xenopsychologist waiting for you in the medical bay. They will need to conclude that you don't pose a threat to anyone else before there is even a chance that you can leave quarantine.

responses.text: I appreciate you giving me this chance.
Their tests had better not be too invasive.
A xeno-what now? Either your translator glitched or that's a word I don't know.

45.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
45.text: Our scientists will examine you. There will be a xenobiologist and a xenopsychologist waiting for you in the medical bay. They will need to conclude that you don't pose a threat to anyone else before there is even a chance that you can leave quarantine.

responses.text: I appreciate you giving me this chance.
Their tests had better not be too invasive.
A xeno-what now? Either your translator glitched or that's a word I don't know.

46.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
46.text: That is up to our scientists. There will be a xenobiologist and a xenopsychologist waiting for you in the medical bay. They will need to conclude that you don't pose a threat to anyone else before there is even a chance that you can leave quarantine.

responses.text: Yes, and I'm thanking you for it.
My manners aren't strange. Yours are.
Well, thanks for doing your duty, then.

47.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
47.text: Your manners are strange, alien. I am doing you no favors. I am doing my duty, which happens to benefit you.

responses.text: Ugh. I bet that means probes.
I guess that's fair.
I don't like any of this.

48.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
48.text: You will submit to whatever examinations they require. That is a condition of your permission to be here.

responses.text: Hey! My people were plenty advanced... probably.
You could be right. If they were advanced, maybe more of them would have escaped.
Well, at least I have thumbs.

49.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
49.text: Scientists who study the minds and bodies of aliens. Perhaps your people were not advanced enough to have a word for such a thing.

51.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
51.text: I am sure I seem as strange to you as you seem to me. However, there are many more of my kind aboard Station Zero, and there is only one of you. That makes you the strange one.

52.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
52.text: I don't know what you speak of, but our scientists will not harm you.

53.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
53.text: Fairness has no bearing on this situation, alien. We do what must be done.

54.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
54.text: Our scientists will not harm you. They would not risk damaging something so difficult to replace.

56.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
56.text: If your story is true, how can you be certain that none of them did? Perhaps more refugees will arrive in the coming solar weeks.

57.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
57.text: I suspect you are mocking me, alien. It will take more than that to anger me, but you are not making a good impression on behalf of your species.

responses.text: END

58.speaker: Gleaming Shoal
58.text: Go meet the scientists. The medical bay is close to the hangar. If you have questions, speak to my assistant, Garnetta, in Administrations.
